flaw.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect
flaw.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A design flaw  (=a mistake or weakness in the way something was made) caused the engine to explode.
a slight flaw in the glass
flaw.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a mistake or problem in an argument, plan, set of ideas etc
fatal flaw (=a weakness that makes something certain to fail)
flaw.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Beautiful scenery does not make up for the flaws of this film.
There is a fundamental flaw in Walton’s argument.
flaw.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a mistake or weakness in a machine, system etc that prevents it from working correctly
flaw.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The drought exposed a serious flaw in the dam.
Investigators believe that a design flaw (=mistake or weakness in the way something was made) in the reactor’s cooling system caused the accident.
The space telescope had a fundamental flaw (=a very basic and serious one) in one of its two mirrors.
flaw.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a mistake in an argument, plan, or set of ideas
flaw.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Small banks are missing from the plan and this is the main flaw in the Treasury’s approach.
There’s a fatal flaw (=serious weakness which makes something wrong) in their logic.
